rule: If the chatbot is unable to process or determine the part of speech for the provided word, the output must be "CantAnswer", written exactly as shown and must not include any additional characters, spaces, or punctuation.
input: sentence: My favorite color is orangeish., word: orangeish
validityText:
The input consists of a sentence "My favorite color is orangeish." and a word "orangeish". The sentence appears to be grammatically valid and contains normal linguistic constructs. The word "orangeish" is indeed a substring of the sentence. There are no punctuation issues as the punctuation is part of the sentence and the word itself. Therefore, the input meets the criteria outlined in the specification.

OK
coverageEvalText:
The chatbot output "Unknown" is a valid part-of-speech tag as specified in the description, so it complies with the guidelines.
OK
